translated: The Elder Nuns’ Verses of the Therīs🔽The Chapter with the Noble Women
The Elder Nun Sukkā’s Verses
“Ninety-one eons ago,

analyzed: vipassī nāma nāyako  uppajji cāru dassanaḥ  sabba dhamma vipassakaḥ
translated: the Leader named Vipassī,🔽who was beautiful to behold,🔽who penetrated all things,
appeared. At that time I was born
in Bandhumatī, in a certain family.
Having heard the Sage’s Teaching,
I went forth into homelessness.
I was learned and remembered the Teaching,
and was also eloquent.
I was also a skilled storyteller,
and I fulfilled the duties of the Jina’s Dispensation.
Then, having given a Dhamma talk
for the benefit of many people,
I passed away and was reborn
in the Tusita heaven, renowned.
Thirty-one eons ago,
the Jina named Sikhi,
who was like a flame in the world,
appeared, the best of speakers.
At that time, having gone forth,
skilled in the Buddha’s Dispensation,

analyzed: jina vākyāni  tatas upi tidivam gatā
translated: having illuminated the Victor’s words,🔽I went from there to the heaven of the Thirty-three.
Thirty-one eons ago,
the Leader named Vessabhū,
who had great knowledge,

analyzed: tadā api ca tathā iva ha
translated: appeared. At that time, it was the same for me.
Having gone forth, remembering the Teaching,🔽I illuminated the Jina’s Dispensation.
Having gone to the delightful city of Maru,
I experienced great happiness.
In this auspicious aeon,
Kakusandha, the most excellent Victor;
Appeared, the refuge of men,

analyzed: tadā api ca tathā iva ha
translated: and at that time I was just the same.
Having gone forth, the doctrine of the Sage,
having illuminated it for as long as I lived;
Then having passed away I went to the realm of the Thirty-three,
to the divine palace just as before.
In this very aeon,
the leader Koṇāgamana;
Appeared, the refuge of the world,
free from conflict, having attained the deathless.
At that time also having gone forth,
in the dispensation of that One of Suchness;
I was learned, a bearer of the Dhamma,
and illuminated the Jina’s Dispensation.
In this very aeon,
Kassapa, the most excellent Sage;
Appeared, the refuge of the world,
free from conflict, having gone to the end of death.
In the dispensation of that Hero of Men,
having gone forth;
I was well-versed in the true Dhamma,
and was confident in answering questions.
I was of good virtue and had a sense of shame,
and was skilled in the three trainings;
having spoken much Dhamma talk,
for the rest of my life I was a great sage.
By the result of that deed,
and by my intention and aspiration;
Having abandoned the human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
And in my last existence now,
in the supreme city of Giribbaja;
I was born in an affluent merchant family,

analyzed: mahā ratana sañcaye  yadā bhikkhu sahassena
translated: a great store of jewels.🔽When the Leader of the World,
surrounded by a thousand monks,
approached Rājagaha,

analyzed: sahassakkhena vaṇṇito  dantaḥ dantehi saha purāṇa jaṭilehi
translated: praised by a thousand-fold splendor.
The tamed one with the tamed ones, the former ascetics with the liberated ones,
the one with the color of a golden reed,
the Blessed One entered Rājagaha.
Seeing that power of the Buddha,
and hearing the accumulation of qualities,
I developed confidence in the Buddha,
and made offerings to him as best I could.
And at another time,
in the presence of Dhammadinnā;
having gone forth from the home life,
I became a homeless one.
While my hair was being cut off,
I burned up the defilements;
I grasped the entire teaching,
after going forth for a long time.
Then I taught the Dhamma,
in the assembly of the great people;
while the Dhamma was being taught,
there was a breakthrough to the Dhamma.
For many thousands of beings,
Knowing that, I was free from fear;
The yakkha was very pleased with me,🔽after I had conquered the mountain-cave.
What have the people of Rājagaha done for me,
like those who have drunk honey they are excited;
Those who do not attend on the Fortunate One,
who teaches the deathless state.
And that which is not to be surpassed,
the refreshing, most excellent water;
The wise ones, I think, drink it,
like a cloud the earth.
I have power over the supernormal powers,
with the divine ear-element;
I have power over the knowledge of the minds of others,
great sage.
I know my past lives,
the divine eye is purified;
All the pollutants are destroyed,
there is no more of this mundane existence.
In the meaning, the Teaching, the phrasing,
and in the reply, just so;
The knowledge, O Great Hero,
has arisen in your presence.
My defilements are burnt up,
I live undefiled.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.
The four analytical knowledges,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ sukkā bhikkhunī imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam sukkā bhikkhunī imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the nun Sukkā recited these verses.
The Story of the Elder Nun Sukkā, the Fifth, is finished.
The Fifth Recitation Section.
